humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage is determined by the number of positive lymph nodes. According to the report, the right breast has 13 positive lymph nodes out of 20 assessed (including 2 of 3 positive sentinel lymph nodes). Therefore, the N stage is N3, as per New Rule 13.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has cancer in 13 out of 20 lymph nodes, including 2 out of 3 sentinel lymph nodes, on the right side. This meets the criteria for N3a stage. The left side has no cancer in the lymph nodes, but the overall N stage is determined by the more advanced side.
